author: KirkMunro
body:
# Steps to reproduce

1. Run the following:

    ```powershell
    $job = Start-Job {
        $i = 0
        while ($true)
        {
            $i++

            $processes = Get-Process | Where-Object {![string]::IsNullOrEmpty($_)} | Group-Object -Property name

            $heavyweights = $processes | Where-Object Count -ge 5
            Write-Output $heavyweights.Count

            if ($i -ge 5) {
                Wait-Debugger
            }

            $middleweights = $processes | Where-Object {$_.Count -ge 2 -and $_.Count -lt 5}
            Write-Output $middleweights.Count

            $featherweights = $processes | Where-Object Count -lt 2
            Write-Output $featherweights.Count

            Start-Sleep -Seconds 1
        }
    }
    while ($job.State -ne 'AtBreakpoint') {
        Start-Sleep -Seconds 1
    }
    Debug-Job -Job $job
    ```

1. Notice that the debugger stopped on the `Wait-Debugger` command in the script file you are running as a job.

1. In the debugger, invoke the `d` command to detach the debugger.

# Expected behavior

PowerShell will detach from the debugger and return to the session where you invoked `Debug-Job`. At this point, the job will run until the next invocation of `Wait-Debugger`, when it will trigger a breakpoint and the state of the job will be reported as "At Breakpoint".

# Actual behavior

PowerShell detaches the debugger and returns to the session you started in, but the job never triggers a breakpoint on `Wait-Debugger`, and the job never reports its status as "At Breakpoint".

# Environment data

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.2.0
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.2.0
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.17763
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```
title: Detaching from a job you are debugging prevents that job from stopping on other breakpoints
